books.author: by Stephanie Johnson and Brandon Stanton
books.description: A profile of a performer who was a well-known burlesque dancer in New York City.
books.name: TANQUERAY

books.author: by Mark Leibovich
books.description: A staff writer at The Atlantic details how some Republicans shifted their loyalty to Donald Trump.
books.name: THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVITUDE

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Pete Hegseth with David Goodwin
books.description: The "Fox & Friends Weekend" host makes his case for what he calls classical Christian education.
books.name: BATTLE FOR THE AMERICAN MIND

books.author: by David Sedaris
books.description: The humorist portrays personal and public upheavals of his life in its seventh decade and the world in the time of a pandemic.
books.name: HAPPY-GO-LUCKY

books.author: by Henry Kissinger
books.description: The former secretary of state profiles the statecraft strategies of Richard Nixon, Margaret Thatcher and others.
books.name: LEADERSHIP

books.author: by Viola Davis
books.description: The multiple award-winning actress describes the difficulties she encountered before claiming her sense of self and achieving professional success.
books.name: FINDING ME

books.author: by Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.
books.name: CRYING IN H MART

books.author: by Malcolm Nance
books.description: The author of “The Plot to Hack America” examines radicalization and terror threats within the United States.
books.name: THEY WANT TO KILL AMERICANS

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The 11th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series gives an account of the global war against terrorists.
books.name: KILLING THE KILLERS

books.author: by James Patterson
books.description: The author’s life, from growing up in small-town New York to working in the advertising industry to becoming a successful storyteller.
books.name: JAMES PATTERSON

books.author: by Tim Miller
books.description: The former Republican political operative assesses why some centrist conservatives fell under the sway of Donald Trump.
books.name: WHY WE DID IT

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: by Ed Yong
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning science writer explains the sensory perceptions and ways of communication used by a variety of animals.
books.name: AN IMMENSE WORLD

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED
